image.altText: A rainbow flag waving outside of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The NT government has walked back on its plans to scrap hate speech protections in the territory's anti-discrimination laws. However there are still fears the changes will "water down" laws against vilification.

title.children: NT government accused of 'watering down' anti-discrimination laws

image.altText: A politician with blonde hair, wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The NT attorney-general has revealed a $300,000 racism review into the NT Police Force has been scrapped, with the funding redirected to Legal Aid.

title.children: NT police racism review scrapped, funding redirected

image.altText: A Timor-Leste player kicking a soccer ball onto the field.

props.synopsis: Timor-Leste representatives say the national soccer team's victory in an Asian Cup qualifier in Darwin isn't just about boosting its chances in the competition, but is also a powerful showcase of culture and community.

title.children: Soccer strengthening cultural ties as Top End hosts Timor-Leste

image.altText: Alexander's daughter in the snow

props.synopsis: While the weather might be drastically different in Tasmania and the NT during winter, the social calendar is equally busy.

title.children: The magic of winter in Tasmania, and the 'chill' in Darwin

image.altText: A person hauls nets and marine debris buried underneath the white sand at a beach in Arnhem Land

props.synopsis: It's rubbish season in northern Australia, when tonnes of plastic and discarded fishing nets wash ashore in the Gulf of Carpentaria. But the future of funding for clean-up patrols is unclear.

title.children: Gulf ghost-net patrols fear tide turning in fight to save remote beaches

image.altText: A smiling woman sits with her laughing daughter on her lap.

props.synopsis: A Sydney mother is calling for change after being told her daughter with disability would have to wait five months for a scan her doctor said was urgent.

title.children: 5yo girl with growth in ear told to wait five months for scan

image.altText: A close up of Albanese with an Australian map behind him

props.synopsis: Defence Minister Richard Marles says he is "sure" the prime minister will meet face-to-face with the US president in the "not so distant future". Follow live.

title.children: PM says he'll 'meet soon' with Trump, vows to reschedule scrapped meeting

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM considering trip to NATO summit
'We're mature about that': PM on cancelled Trump meeting
Albanese raised tariffs and critical minerals with US officials

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese speaks at the G7 in Canada

props.synopsis: Seven months in the making, Anthony Albanese told reporters that he had prepared extensively to finally meet with US President Donald Trump. Then a social media post landed with a thud.

title.children: Albanese was brimming with confidence. Minutes later, Trump changed plans

image.altText: Next ATM in a closed tobacconist in Burpengary

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation finds that among investments raking in the dollars for the Australian-founded Macquarie Group is the nation's billion-dollar illegal tobacco trade.

title.children: Macquarie Group-backed private ATMs are helping fuel the illegal tobacco trade

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith wearing a blue shirt and white shirt with a tie

props.synopsis: Veteran Ben Roberts-Smith takes his legal battle with Nine Newspapers to the High Court.

title.children: 'A condemnation of the most ruinous kind': Ben Roberts-Smith appeals to High Court

image.altText: Billy Slater speaks to the media at a press conference

props.synopsis: Billy Slater has claimed former NSW prop Aaron Woods does not deserve a voice in the media after he labelled the Queensland coach a "grub".

title.children: Slater slams Woods for 'derogatory' comment in emotional defence

image.altText: A graphic imge of a farmer looking at sheep.

props.synopsis: Mental health experts warn of the dangers of spreading misinformation after unverified figures of the number of Victorian farmers who have taken their own lives circulated on social media.

title.children: Warning for MPs over 'dangerous' mental health misinformation

image.altText: Three men wearing hi-vis and hard hats, one of them speaks at microphone

props.synopsis: The federal energy minister will announce changes to how benchmark power prices are set, aimed at cutting back how much energy retailers can hit consumers to cover costs like advertising, on Wednesday.

title.children: Federal government to change power price rules to push costs lower

image.altText: A rock carving of an emu on red rocks

props.synopsis: After UNESCO expressed concern that the extension of Woodside's North West Shelf gas facility would cause nearby Murujuga rock art to be rejected from the World Heritage List, the environment minister will dispatch officials to lobby the agency to reconsider.

title.children: Government to protest UNESCO concerns for Murujuga rock art in Paris

image.altText: Generic childcare picture

props.synopsis: Parents, educators and experts say the reforms are tokenistic, a band-aid fix, and ignore the deeper structural failures festering in the childcare system.

title.children: Until the childcare sector has meaningful reform, voiceless children will suffer hideous incidents

image.altText: a group walk along a country road in Western Victoria bounded by dry paddocks

props.synopsis: A Yoorrook Justice Commissioner is set to reach Victorian parliament after walking 500 kilometres to mark the closure of Australia’s first formal Aboriginal truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: Thousands join walk as Australian-first truth-telling inquiry ends

image.altText: removing ice from a car winscreen

props.synopsis: There are several dos and don'ts to making sure you safely defrost your car's windscreen.

title.children: The best ways to quickly and safely remove ice from your car windscreen

image.altText: Jim Chalmers GDP figures

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers will throw open the door to a wider debate on potential tax changes at the government's economic reform summit in August as the treasurer hangs a lantern on Labor's "obligation to work out what comes next".

title.children: Treasurer opens door to tax debate at productivity roundtable

image.altText: Several seals laying on a shelf of ice in Antarctica.

props.synopsis: Australia's ability to conduct strategic, in-depth, and long-term research in Antarctica is being compromised by "terminating" funding models for key programs, scientists warn.

title.children: Antarctic research jeopardised by 'terminating' funding, scientists say

image.altText: A man in a royal blue suit, white shirt and light blue tie sits in a room with red carpet looking toward something out of frame

props.synopsis: General He Weidong, China's second-ranking military official and a co-vice-chairman of the powerful Central Military Commission, has not been seen in public since March.

title.children: Beijing's inner circle fractures as Xi's top military official disappears

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a denim top holding a teddy

props.synopsis: Newborn baby Alby died after an obstructed labour. Despite an initial coroner's report ruling his death was not preventable, a fresh investigation has been launched.

title.children: Inquest for newborn baby boy who died in Queensland hospital

image.altText: A black digital camera screen shows a picture of a woman in a book store

props.synopsis: Point-and-shoot digital cameras are popping up at bars and clubs across Australia as young people bring back the fashion and technology of the early 2000s.

title.children: Why your old digital camera is cool again

image.altText: Several rescuers carrying with a collapsed building behind them.

props.synopsis: Russia launches hundreds of drones on the Ukrainian capital, killing at least 18 and injuring dozens more.

title.children: Russian strike on Kyiv kills 18, as G7 statement scrapped due to US resistance

image.altText: A green ceramic mug sits beside an open laptop displaying a conference call with a group of colleagues.

props.synopsis: Business groups say those who work from home should not expect to receive overtime and penalty rates if they have the flexibility to choose their own hours.

title.children: Union wants 'presumed' right to work from home, as Labor weighs new law

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing to the stadium.

title.children: From the stadium to health. Here's what the parties are promising Tasmanians

image.altText: A front and back mock up of the gold trump iPhone

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and his family are getting into the telecommunications industry, but questions remain whether the marketed Made in the USA phone can actually be manufactured domestically.

title.children: Trump family unveils gold Made in America phone, mobile service

image.altText: Four people stand inside a big cave.

props.synopsis: Deep in the Blue Mountains, archaeologists uncover artefacts that reveal secrets of the nation's Ice Age past.

title.children: Hidden in a Blue Mountains cave are artefacts that change the story of a nation

image.altText: man in black tee and shorts with face covered with a black hood and handcuffs being led by a group of plain clothes officers .

props.synopsis: Indonesia's National Police Chief General Listyo Sigit says two people have been arrested in connection to a shooting that killed one Australian and injured another.

title.children: Two arrested in connection to deadly Bali shooting

image.altText: A bald man in police uniform.

props.synopsis: Constable Keith Smith was fatally shot while attempting to serve a court-ordered repossession notice at a property in a rural area of Tasmania's north-west.

title.children: Suspect remains under guard in hospital after fatal police shooting

image.altText: a bus parked in a carpark, near a clearing.

props.synopsis: The bus company linked to the deadly 2023 Hunter Valley bus crash, and its directors and managers, are being prosecuted for alleged heavy-vehicle law breaches.

title.children: Bosses of bus company linked to Hunter Valley crash face prosecution

image.altText: Signage of Logan City Council at main administration building with garden in view on Wembley Road at Logan City.

props.synopsis: Queensland's only certified carbon neutral council will lose that title as it prepares to pull out of a federal government scheme it has concerns with.

title.children: Queensland's last carbon neutral council to lose title after leaving federal program

image.altText: Smiling woman sitting in car holding rolled and wrapped newspaper in her hand out the window

props.synopsis: Wendy Russ has delivered newspapers seven days a week, "rain, hail or shine", and kept watch over her close-knit coastal community while perfecting her tossing technique.

title.children: Community hero to retire after 20 years of tossing newspapers

image.altText: A woman with grey hair and black shirt and blue gloves smiles, inside a mortuary.

props.synopsis: Full embalming is required by law in NSW if the deceased is being put into an above ground burial or to be sent overseas on a repatriation. Here's what the process actually looks like.

title.children: Opposite of a 'dark, dungeon mortuary': Inside the work of an embalmer

image.altText: A crowd at an arts festival with brightly coloured cloth roofing.

props.synopsis: Victoria's eight-year-old psychedelic music and arts festival, which locked out punters at the last minute this year, goes into voluntary administration owing millions to ticketholders, contractors and employees.

title.children: Esoteric Festival bites the dust in a $2.8 million swirl of debt
